meanings.definition: The state of being in close proximity or contact with something.
meanings.sent1: The contiguity of the two houses made it easy for the neighbors to chat over the fence.
meanings.sent2: The contiguity of the two buildings allowed for easy access between them.
meanings.sent3: The contiguity of the two trees made it look like they were holding hands.
meanings.sent4: The contiguity of the puzzle pieces was crucial to completing the picture.
meanings.sent5: The contiguity of the ingredients on the kitchen counter made cooking a breeze.

meanings.definition: The quality of being adjacent or touching.
meanings.sent1: The contiguity of the two buttons on the remote control made it easy to switch channels.
meanings.sent2: The contiguity of the two rooms allowed for a seamless transition between them.
meanings.sent3: The contiguity of the two colors on the painting created a striking contrast.
meanings.sent4: The contiguity of the words on the page made it hard to distinguish where one sentence ended and the next began.
meanings.sent5: The contiguity of the flowers in the garden made it a beautiful sight to behold.
